contentrichtext.text: [[Image:030411ac millgreen4sm.jpg|thumb|Mill Green Museum]] '''Mill Green Museum''' is a working 18th century [[watermill]] in [[Hatfield, Hertfordshire|Hatfield]], [[Hertfordshire]], [[England]].<ref>[http://www.aboutbritain.com/MillGreenMuseumandMill.htm Mill Green Museum and Mill], [http://www.aboutbritain.com/ AboutBritain.com], UK.</ref> It is managed by [[Welwyn Hatfield Borough Council]] and admission is Â£2.50 for adults and free for children under 16. Its heart is a working watermill, with 18th and 19th century wooden machinery restored to full working order. It is in regular use to grind [[organic farming|organic]] wheat for a local bakery and for retail sale. Visitors can explore the mill, see it working and chat to the miller on duty. Flour is sold in various sizes. The mill also houses the [[local museum]] in the old miller's house. Three galleries show changing displays of art and local history.
